newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: SLOVAK C.BANK SETS 7-DAY REV REPO TENDER FOR TUES.
newsitem.headline: SLOVAK C.BANK SETS 7-DAY REV REPO TENDER FOR TUES.

text.p: The National Bank of Slovakia (NBS) said on Tuesday it had set a tender for a seven-day securities reverse repurchase for 10 a.m. (0900 GMT), offering to drain an unspecified volume of market liquidity.
The NBS said in a statement that the American-style tender would have no fixed minimum rate.
According to official NBS figures, the banking sector has a liquidity surplus, with banks' minimum reserve demands fulfilled at 100.53 percent as of Monday, after 100.17 percent the previous day.
In its last reverse repo tender for a six-day maturity last Friday, the average rate was 17.0 percent, after 17.3 percent in Thursday's reverse repo tender with a seven-day maturity.
